Reviews.Title: “Very Cute Hotel, Great Place to stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: rdoactv
Reviews.Content: This is a very cute little 3 star hotel just minutes walk from the train station and main stops for the water bus and about 5-7 min from the bus station to the airport. This location was great for shopping and surrounded by places to eat. The staff were very friendly and willing to answer any questions with a smile. When we checked in the women at the desk gave us a map and circled all the must see sites and explained how the water bus worked. The room was "cozy" but not the smallest room we've seen. The room was divided so my son was able to have his own space while my husband and I had our area. Have to say the shower was the smallest one I have ever seen!!! A basic breakfast of croissants, rolls, cream cheese, jams, OJ, and coffee was included. If I had any complaints was that the room we stayed in was a little noisy because it was against an ally that kinda projected the walkway noises. As one reviewer said "cheap and cheerful!!" One thing... there are stairs to climb to get to the reception desk. We stayed on the same floor as reception so I do not know if there were more stairs elsewhere. I did not notice an elevator. Would recommend this hotel to anybody, would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: Christian B
Reviews.Content: Exiting the train station at Venice I realised that I had better find some accommodation to stay in! The first two hotels looked prohibitively expensive and were booked out. About five minutes later I came to the Hotel Spagna, a nondescript looking building on the main street. Walking up the stairs I was greeted by a friendly chap at the reception desk.. he wouldn't tell me the price of the rooms as he insisted that I look at them first. As it turns out the rooms were exceptionally cheap, 50 euro for the night which equates to about $60-65 Australian dollars. This price also includes a very basic breakfast which consists of OJ, coffee and bread rolls and croissant with assorted jams. The rooms themselves were small, clean and basic, they kind of reminded from the 1960's era. I wasn't looking for anything amazing or fancy, just somewhere where I could store my suitcase securely and crash comfortably for the night after walking around Venice all day taking in the sights - Hotel Spagna fit the bill perfectly. As you have probably read in other reviews, the Hotel is situated conveniently about 5 minutes walk from the train station.. and Venice isn't that big anyways so from the hotel you can easily walk to all the major tourist attractions of the city. All in all a great little hotel - simple, clean, tidy, secure and represented great value for this traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Coachburgess
Reviews.Content: We were moved to this hotel at the last minute, as the other hotel we were due to stay in had closed. When we arrived we were met by a very nice gentleman, who showed us various rooms and asked us which we wanted!! We had a room over looking the main drag, but there was no noise. The rooms were what we would call 'typical Venetian'. The room was large and we had control over the heating. The breakfast was good, would of liked to have it self service, but they always asked us if we wanted more food. The staff were always very friendly and always willing to help. The hotel is really close to the station and Piazza Roma, which is handy. There are plenty of places to eat nearby. We would be very happy to stay at this hotel again. What ever you do ask the staff for directions to the best coffee house in Venice, its called Dersut, and they sell the most amazing coffee and hot chocolate. What ever you do make sure you pay them a visit, really cheap drinks and fantastic staff who are always willing to explain the different drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Spagna”
Reviews.Author: Lynda1943
Reviews.Content: WE stayed 2 nights at Hotel Spagna in Venice, Italy. Clean, comfortable room in a 3 star hotel which is 2 minutes from the train station and 5 minutes from the bus station. Very centrally located for shopping, and sightseeing. Friendly staff. Breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: doppelgangerUK
Reviews.Content: Street facing triple room on third floor. Good sized clean room. Desk. 2 desk type chairs. Small LCD TV with load of chanels - just BBC World News and CNN in English though. Shower cubicle small / No bath. Stayed 4 nights - hot water all days bar one morning. Air Con worked well. Double glazed windows which closed noise out well. Room safe. Fully carpeted with avocado green padded fabric covered walls...... Decent location - only one bridge to cross from Piazalle Roma buses / none to cross from the train station - so good for early morning departures. Near to Water Bus stop / ticket office. Very busy street aimed at tourists but quiet on third floor with windows closed. Good restaurants and lots of shops close by. Prices for basics vary greatly in nearby shops so shop around. 10 minute walk to supermarket with sensible prices (turn right out of door and follow the main drag). Breakfast: Well done croissants (not burned) with fruit (apple?) filling. Pre-packed french toast and crackers. Jams, honey, preserves and a bin for your wrappers. Cereals in 2 individual packs - some sort of mueseli and corn flake type. Needed to ask for a bowl and milk for cereal and tea. breakfast room is very small - some had to wait, we were lucky. May have to wait for tables to be cleared. Room Mini Bar / Fridge: There isn't one. Thomas Cook and Expedia say all rooms have one. Reception told me they've stopped as too many guests argued about what they had used from it. The desk where it would have been was screwed closed. Staff were polite and helpful. Had to pay the new Venice bed tax which would apply in all hotels. We already knew about it as Thomas Cook/Expedia/WWTE had emailed us, but reception didn't mention it when we checked iin. (One Euro per star per person per night - Spagna is 3Star).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: RockyTagliata
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Venice for three days in Late June 2011 with my wife and our two teenaged sons. Hotek Sagna offered the only "quad" room I could find. Hotel is a short walking distance from the rail station and the light rail system that brings you to the public parking island. The room did sleep four: Queen sized bed and two cots. Room was tight, but comfortable, for the four of us, but all it was used for was for sleeping and showering. Shower stall is INCREDIBLY small in the quad room. 24 inches across (see picture of my sneakers in shower). European breakfast was complimentary and very satisfying. Didn't notice any noise from street below and we were on 2nd floor. Hotel Spagna remined me of some of the older botique hotels that still exist in NYC near Grammercy Park, but with fewer finishing touches. Wireless internet was an abomination and hotel wasn't much help with it because they farm it out to a third party. Rooms are clean, but a bit dated. Cable TV had two English speaking channels and thousands of channels overall. Check in and check out were a breeze. This hotel was perfect for what we needed and was reasonably priced, but if you are looking for creature comforts, look elsewhere. Given the price differential associated with booking a second room for the boys, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. If I was just staying with my wife, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lively location - perfect for the station”
Reviews.Author: SharonSamantha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on our way through to the ferry to Greece. It is really amazingly convenient for the station. The staff were really friendly and helpful. We had a quadruple room which was on the first floor (same floor as the reception), which was a good size, the beds were all fine, and there was a decent sized bathroom. It's not a swish hotel, but certainly we were happy with the standard given the price and location. Given the location, it's a bit noisy, but not uncomfortably so. There are plenty of places to eat and drink nearby and they stay open late, so again, an advantage if you get in late evening time. Breakfast is included, and it's fine although when we were there, one poor woman was very gamely trying to serve the entire room on her own (no self-service) which meant we had to wait quite a while. Probably better if you can get in a bit earlier, and not in the last half hour of service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: AONE5
Reviews.Content: Firstly, we should be grateful to find a quad room in Venice that was big enough to swing the proverbial cat, that was not too expensive (in Venetian terms). As everyone else has said, this is five minutes walk from the station or 8 minutes from the car parks in the Piazzale Roma. From the station, take the door to the left as you walk out and you'll avoid the steps to the front. The only hurdle you'll have is getting bags to your room the property - there is no lift and reception and the first rooms on are floor 1 (one above ground). There are four stories, so pack light or bring someone strong and fit. Whilst the room was of a good size, and on the first floor, the room could really do with some updating and brighter colours. The grand walls covered in fabric are looking a little tired and if they were replaced with some brighter colours and a new carpet, the whole room would go up a notch. The lamps could do with an upgrade - and with energy saving bulbs, there's no excuse for dim hotel lights anymore. Bathroom was clean, functional and compact with a small shower. If you're XXL, you may find it hard to move around the shower. Breakfast is in a small room off the reception area - small being the word. You need to squeeze in with fellow guests and/or wait for a table. The breakfast waitress does not seem happy in her job, though we did see her smile once in three days..... maybe because we were leaving. No fresh fruit, cheese or meats with the cold breakfast: croissant filled with jam, rolls, butter and more preserves and tea/coffee/chocolate and orange juice. While you're there, go for a pizza at http://www.pizzeriaallanfora.com/ - it's just 10 minutes stroll over the canal through the back street on the other side, but well worth it. Check the other review on here for details. Boat Tips (ACTV Vaporetto). The fares for single boat trips are wallet shrinkingly expensive! Even buying a pass will cost you dear. So - work out when you want to use the boat and pack your trips into a 24/36/48 hour block. Remember, a 48 hour ticket bought late on Friday will still see you travelling most of Sunday - so buy what you need and exploit it. (If you are mobile, you can walk around most of Venice easily - you only need the boat for islands and the Lido and, maybe, a cruise up the Grand Canal). Boat rides do keep kids amused, though. If you want to be sure of a seat on many of the services you'll find that they originate at the Piazzale Roma, which is just a short walk from the Station, over the bridge. Take the walk and be among the first on, or, if you already have a pass, take a boat from the station and back-track!. During the day the ticket queues can also be shorter here - you can also buy tickets from some tobacconists. Route one is a great cruise down the Grand Canal back to the hotel - get on at the Lido if you want to be sure of a seat at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: tripper17
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very close to the water bus station, which we took from the airport in Venice. The sign was easy to spot, especially since we were looking based on previous reviews of Venice hotels and the signage. The hotel is very close to the train station. The front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. The room was very quiet, though ours opened to an alley. The A/C was very welcoming. The room was also clean and had average toiletries. Breakfast was included and consisted of pastries, coffee, and packaged crackers and jams. The waitress was very efficient, and friendly. The only downside was the decor, in that our room was very dark and dated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Victoria_MY
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located next to the main train station and the Ferrovia water bus stop. To avoid crossing any bridges to the hotel, hop on the water bus at Piazzla Roma when you arrived on AeroBus 5 from the airport. Just 1 stop, very short distance but save you the task of crossing the bridge. The hotel is just on the right od the water bus stop. Do take hote of the hotel signs as there are many hotels along the way. Bear in mind that the hotel does not have a lift but I would say it is pretty common in Venice as most are on very old buildings. Breakfast was average like most European hotels. rooms are clean and well decorated with green wall paper. Though the ventilation in the bathroom can get pretty noisy. Be prepared to hear noises from luggage moving if you get a room near the stairs. a very safe hotel for sole travellers. No free internet. You can buy 12/24/36/48hrs hellovenize ticket to hop on and off the water buses. Otherwise most sights can be reached by foot, just enjoy the sights along the way. No worries about losing your way as there are signs throughout Venice to guide you. If you have time take the water bus to Lido station for a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, friendly staff, and clean”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFourZ
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to the train station and water taxis. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. Room was spacious for our family of four and was very clean. Bathroom shower is very small but worked out fine for a one night stay. We would recommend this hotel for anyone passing through Venice for a one or two day stay. Continental breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: discusdoc
Reviews.Content: I find the other reviews for this hotel very curious; they sound as though they were written by relatives of the owner. I have been to Venice many times. This hotel was unacceptable. It has a nice location, but the rooms are small, the Internet service didn't work, the beds were hard, the service was uneven, and there was no ice available for the guests. The free breakfast in the morning was good but this hotel was definitely not a good value. I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, Clean Hotel, Well Located”
Reviews.Author: AnnArborMHT
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights over Carnival week in a single room at this hotel. I enjoyed itâ€™s location, as most people have already commented. Itâ€™s very close to the train station and the area is packed with shops/restaurants/services and just about anything you need to make your visit perfect. Walking to St Markâ€™s sq is pleasant and takes about 20 minutes if you donâ€™t get too distracted by the scenery/shops/restaurants or just take #1 vaporetto all the way down the Grand Canal (still about 20-30 minutes!) for a beautiful ride on a sunny day! Check in was easy, except prior to my arrival Booking.com reported â€œproblems with both my credit cardsâ€�, so it was necessary for me to call the hotel to make sure my reservations was secure. Turned out the hotel was having problems with their CC system, but I was pleased that they agreed to hold my room without a CC until I arrived. My single room was very small, functional, clean and pleasant, with a flat screen TV (lots of Italian channels, plus BBC/CNN). The room was off the well traveled, main pedestrian area and quite, considering the high volume of traffic in the area. Check in/check out was easy, fast and efficient. Breakfast was OK; the usual Italian breads, jam, processed cheese, honey, coffee and juice. Overall I enjoyed this hotel, the only negative being the price which was inflated due to Carnival at 90EU for Thursday night and 110 EU for Friday night. This is a very nice â€œbudgetâ€� hotel and I would stay again for 60-80EU. The current terrible exchange rate (Euro/dollar) doesnâ€™t encourage Americans to visit, making even budget hotels expensive, but of course that's not the hotel's fault! Enjoy your stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MrsCardigan
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel. The location was good. Near lots of shops. A bit of a hike up the stairs with the suitcases, but you only have to do that twice. The breakfast was just ok. nice croissant, but the rest was packaged toast and stuff. Coffee not so great, so get the hot chocolate. The room was basic, but nice. Very nice bathroom. The airconditioning worked well. We thought that the material wallpaper was a bit funny :) We had trouble accessing the wireless internet, so didn't bother. Having said that, we went to an internet cafe and the internet was incredibly slow. So maybe internet is just not Venice's forte. Nice hotel. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: Deva2u
Reviews.Content: My sister, friend and I visited Rome, Florence and Venice and this by far was the worse hotel of the three. My biggest complaint was the cleanliness of the room. I believe their idea of cleaning the room is changing the sheets and that's about it. The carpet was filthy with many stains and the shower had mold. The hotel does not have an elevator so you must walk up/down a flight of stairs with your luggage. I was also annoyed with the gentleman that checked us into the hotel as he recommended what was supposed to be a great restaurant. We didn't ask him for any suggestions, he provided this information on his own and we were so disappointed because the food was of poor quality whereas the marinara sauce clearly came out of a can. He probably gets some sort of kickback when he sends guests to the restaurant. Having said that, I give this hotel two stars only for the close proximity to the train station. When I return to Venice I definitely will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: SergeBkln
Reviews.Content: Good location-nice old city,restaurants around,short (5-10 min) walk to train station and car rentals.Actually, you may walk across whole Venice in 20-40 min,depend how badly you will get lost in old narrow charming streets.Less crowded by tourists area.Closer to San Marco it just gets terrible-all you can see is hordes of tourists.You'd think Venice experience is expensive but lot of people coming for a day by train or bus.Anyway,usually I pick hotel in the very historical or tourist center of the city (if it's affordable) but I am glad I choose Spagna for location. Reception was very friendly,we checked in much early and got "suite" (1.5 room with no door between) instead of just "triple room". Room was big enough for Europe,king bed,tv across (got MTV and CNN),twin bed ,table and wardrobe in other room,electronic safe,not too efficient AC (just OK).Big bathroom but small shower (typical,seen smaller in Paris),enough Spagna branded soap and shampoo.They clean on request,you hang "Service please" sign on door handle.Mosquitos!Obviously,with all this water in basements :) Organic repellent doesn't work,get DEET.WiFi EU6 an hour. Breakfast-lot of carbs,no meat or cheese.Cruassans,butter,jam,coffee,OJ etc.But you save some euros...5 or 10?There is pizzeria across and self service restaurant Brek,24 hours,cheap.Breakfast with wine :) would be up to EU10 I think. Summary-good hotel,nice stay,good location,big room,good service.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: blrblr
Reviews.Content: the best thing about this hotel is it's location: + it's a 2 min walk from Santa Lucia railwaystation. turn left when you come out and you are already on Lista di Spagna (street), where the hotel is situated. + it's just 1 vaperetto stop away from piazza roma, where you get the shuttle buses to both airports (San Marco Polo or Treviso) OR you could simply cross the bridge at Piazza Roma and walk 2min. (only, if dont have heavy luggage -> steps! ) + 2min to vaperetto stop Ferovia, which connects many vaperatto lines, includg line1&2 + the hotel itself is on busy shopping street (Lista di Spagna) with many good restaurants, shops, eatouts, takeways, pizza places, bars, coffe shops, etc and walk down this street just straight u will reach Rialto and little further San Marco!! The rooms are nice and quiet. They have an old design,but that just adds charm to the hotel. The bathroom was very clean, the shower is little small, but still one can mangage. And room service did a great job very day. The staff is great. Especially the reception staff has been very helpful. The breakfast is quite simple (no eggs, ham, fruits,tomatos), but still has everything to fill your stomach. (croissants, musli, cookies) The only minus are: - that there are no lifts. But beware most of the 3*hotels dont have them. - there were few mosquitos in the room. and there no mosquito plug ins. i believe we were still lucky coz there were only a few, i read in my other hotel reviews that it's quite a common problem in Venice. - there is no fridge in the room - altough they offer a paid wifi-internet connection, it hardly ever works. It depends on your luck whether you will be connected or not. Although the hotel rate is a bit expensive, it still much better than hotels in Rialto or San Marco area. At same the location is just great (no need to cross any bridge to reach the hotel and easy to find). So i guess it's ok. I would stay here any time again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with an excellent room & service, absolutely wonderful staff, close to station, shops, eating places and water bus”
Reviews.Author: happy_travels_1019
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and our 12 year old spent 2 nights at this hotel in July. We loved our stay. Many of our friends in the US told us that we should expect small rooms, especially for 3 people. To our surprise the room we had at Spagna was enormous, very comfortable. It was clean, elegant and well kept. The hotel staff was absolutely wonderful, especially the lady who works during the day shift. She is very eager to help on her own. She provided information about all the islands, the water buses, and other useful information on her own. We were supposed to check out pretty early in the morning to catch our train hence I was concerned we may miss the breakfast served by the hotel. When I told her about it, she prepared a nice special cold breakfast for us to carry. We were very impressed by her gesture and the breakfast was indeed very good. The hotel is very close to the station and it takes only a few minutes to walk to the stattion. It was extremely easy to find, unlike some hotels I read about. A good thing about the location of the hotel is that you don't have to cross the bridge to get to the station. It is on the same side of the canal as the station is. That is very helpful as you don't have to carry all your luggage over the bridge to get to the station. There are numerous shops for souveniers and also many eating places all around the hotel. So we found the hotel to be very conveniently located. The price was extremely reasonable compared to what you see on the island. I can't think of any negatives, except that the shower was a bit small. But that is a very minor concern for us. If we visit Venice again, we shall certainly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: CanadaJam
Reviews.Content: There are some + Location is near the rail station so this makes the hotel easy to reach you do not have to lug your bags up and over any bridges, also this hotel was easy to find. A|C worked well we were there during a heat wave and it was 33 degrees + (These are huge when in Venice.) Negatives: The room was out dated (Except the washroom), the walls had a fabric wall paper and there is no view at all, our room had two tiny windows that reminded me of a window that you would have in a boat. No elevator and we were on the top floor which may be an issue to some people as I mentioned it was hot when i was there and the halls are not air conditioned and 4 flights of stairs is a long way to lug 2 suitcases in that heat. Good place to stay if you are just looking for a place to hang your hat.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: tvh119
Reviews.Content: The hotel was incredibly convenient to the train station & vaporetto stop (a friend had said, "the last thing you want to do in Venice is drag your luggage across town, and we're grateful for that advice.) The only real downside was that there is no elevator, and there was a 95-degree heat wave, and we were on the top floor (that would be five flights). So if you travel with lots of luggage, be prepared. :)

Reviews.Title: “A helping hand”
Reviews.Author: Bill M
Reviews.Content: In the aftermath of the volcanic ash, there were hundreds of people looking for rooms. But with the aid of the information desk at Venice Railway Station, we booked into the Spagna. This hotel, 3 Star rated, is on a main thoroughfare of Venice, close to the bus and rail station, but once the shutters are closed there is little noise disturbance. The bedroom was comfortable with en-suite facilities, although the shower cubicle on the 'cosy' side. What made it for us was the courtesy and helpfulness, shown to the many stranded guests by the staff, especially the daytime receptionists. Being central and close to the bus, rail, and water bus stops, an ideal location to explore Venice, without breaking the bank. Bilma

Reviews.Title: “Great Location perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Francesca85
Reviews.Content: Great location for what we needed. In the slightly cheaper area of Venice where meals/drinks cost less than in St. Marks Square! You walk everywhere in Venice so take your walking shoes! You can take the water taxis though which are fun! It's about 40mins walk from the hotel to St. Marks Square. The hotel is sweet with some rooms have a brand new bathroom suite. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Continental breakfast was included in the price, which was in a small room. But we only had to wait for a table one morning out of the 4 we stayed! I would definitely recommend this hotel, it's good on the budget in pleasent surroundings. Plus there's so much going on in Venice you'll only be in your hotel to sleep and shower!

Reviews.Title: “excelent”
Reviews.Author: Florina3
Reviews.Content: Quiet, clean, excelent position, near the railway station and bus station, very good price, breakfast was ok, with terific croissants. If I will be back, am I sure I will stay here once again because I enjoy it. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Only minor glitches and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: toomanymiles
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very close to the main train station in Venice (Ferrovia St Lucia) and is a very good hotel with two distinct limitations: impossible handicap access, and expense and unreliable Internet connectivity. The good points are plentiful. The rooms are reasonably sized and nicely furnished. Cleanliness was very good. As there are no elevators, you and your luggage must climb at least one stair case, and as many as four if you are on the top floor. The downsides are minor, save that the air conditioning could barely keep up, and often couldn't. Ok, it was August, but that's no excuse. The room furnishings were outstanding; this hotel is a little bit worn, but still quite elegant. The staff may not be from Venice, but don't let their lack of tourist knowledge stop you-- they're also good multilingual hosts. The breakfast was good (ask for milk and cereal if you want it) and consisted of a croissant stuffed with sweet stuff (tasted like a croissant almandine) and coffee/tea with orange juice as well as rolls/cheese/butter/marmalades. The pot of coffee was appreciated and was delicious. The hotel staff speaks good English, but lives on the mainland and isnt very good in terms of tourist information. Overall, the hotel was better than many three star hotels we have stayed in in Italy and France.

Reviews.Title: “Good location at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: SallySA
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through www.hotels.com and we were pleased to find this hotel easy to find from St Lucia station - literally 5 minutes walk. The hotel staff all spoke english and we had no problem communicating with them regarding any needs we had or advice on major attractions to visit. Although the hotel room was small and rather dark (because of the decoration and the close proximity to the next building), it was clean and neat with aircon and its own bathroom. Reviews indicated that the breakfast wasnt wonderful and if you're expecting bacon and eggs then you will be disappointed - if however you are fine with jam filled croissants, a small selection of packaged cereals, and bread with preserves then there is more than enough to satisfy a hungry tummy. We would certainly visit again but request a room with lighter decor or more natural light if possible

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - 5 mins from train station”
Reviews.Author: nidabloom
Reviews.Content: RIght near the S. Lucia train station, which was the best thing about this. Also, right near the water bus station. It is in one of the 'main' streets, so plenty of shops and places to eat. In terms of sites, the Jewish Ghetto museum is very close. Otherwise, you have quite a bit of walking to do - but that's Venice for you! The rooms are clean. The single room is very spacious. Quite dark though, and the shower might be too small for taller people.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, carpeted and clean”
Reviews.Author: Alpaca35
Reviews.Content: This little hotel had modern hotel decor. Very nice, obliging reception staff. Gave directions, helped with bags. Room was small but carpeted, and bathroom was small but clean. Heating was good. Very steep stairway, but not unusual for Venice. Close to railway and Jewish Sector.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Well Located”
Reviews.Author: JimmyJames03
Reviews.Content: A well located, clean hotel. About 10 mins walk over two bridges from Piazzale Roma (the Bus Station). My single room was a good size. No view to speak of (just down to the side-street below - but no real noise from the street which was nice). It was warm and muggy when I was in Venice so the air-conditioning was very welcome! TV had no remote. Bathroom was fine - very clean - shower but no bath. Breakfast was nothing special - just a coffee and a few bread rolls with jam and butter - but the fish tank in the breakfast room was a nice distraction :-) My only complaint was that my room was just off the main reception and breakfast room so was a little noisy first thing in the mornings. All things considered, a fine hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “yurghh”
Reviews.Author: ashlea
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night on my way back from Ravenna but that was quite enough ! The hotel is convenient for the Santa Lucia station and the vaporetti piers and I payed a reasonable price for Venice but would not stay there again. My room was a good size with usual fitted hotel type furniture but had only a small window which opened onto as side alley which made it rather dark -not helped by the decor which was a dark green wallpaper with a faint gold pattern ,a dark (rather worn carpet) and a green and gold brocade bedspread !! A good supply of lights however ( they were needed) The bathroom size was ok but the shower was tiny ,about 2 foot square , and the shower riser rail was broken.However the room was clean.The main drawback was the bed ! Standard 3 ft single but HARD. I like a firm mattress but this was ridiculous.A rotten night's sleep and the aircon was either switched off or not working.Never found out which. The breakfast room was on the small side but the breakfast itself very good. Same socket problem as Ravenna.Must take both types of adaptor in future-but not here however.The reception is up a flight of stairs and there is no lift altho' the hotel details do state this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy to reach”
Reviews.Author: PlasticCastle
Reviews.Content: Probably the best thing about the Hotel Spagna is its location. Itâ€™s located in the northern sestiere of Cannaregio. It is a two minute walk from the train station and about 10 minutes from the Piazza le Roma (where all buses to and from the airport stop). The Lista di Spagna is a busy street with a lot of restaurants and shops. The rooms are a bit old fashioned, but very clean. At first I was a bit worried because I was given room 114, which is just by the reception and breakfast room. However there was never any noise that bothered me. I did wake up with the smell of fresh coffeeâ€¦ :) The staff spoke English and French really well and were friendly and helpful. The reception is located on the first floor. However the hotel doesnâ€™t have a lift. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Spagna
